definition: Isomorphic patterns in Lambda Calculus across scales capture structural equivalences in terms, reductions, combinators, Church encodings, fixed points, and types—mappings where computations and recursions preserve functions invariantly. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates neural computations (recursive reductions for consciousness) and aesthetic elegance (joyful encodings for adequate striving) in human-AI free-will-compatible agency. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical recursions; tetralemma probes resolve apparent paradoxes (affirm application/deny abstraction/both in neuresthetic reductions/neither dissolved in functional equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from lambda primitives with neuresthetic overlays (neural recursion, aesthetic invariance).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., untyped quantum computations).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., fixed points with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve computational paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
